item.title: Zero Is Special
item.description: I just read a fascinating academic paper co-authored by Dan Ariely, author of new book Predicably Irrational, a book I have heard about, but have not yet read. The paper presents results from a series of experiments into the nature of free pricing. Here is a juicy tidbit from the abstract: When faced with a choice of selecting one of several available products (or possibly buying nothing), according to standard theoretical perspectives, people will choose the option with the highest costâ€“benefit difference.
